text:
Daryl Frank Dragon (August 27, 1942 – January 2, 2019) was a American musician and songwriter. He was known as Captain from the pop musical duo Captain & Tennille, with his former wife, Toni Tennille.
Biography.
In 1981, Dragon contributed to Carpenters' "Made In America" album, programming synthesizers on "(Want You) Back In My Life Again". In 1996, Dragon played keyboard on a number of tracks on the self-titled album by pop punk band Size 14.
In 2009, Dragon was diagnosed with a neurological disorder which causes him to have tremors.
Dragon died on January 2, 2019 in Prescott, Arizona from renal failure at the age of 76.

annotations.surface_form: "(Want You) Back In My Life Again"
